content.description:
This is the leftmost route on Upper Kid Power Tower and sits just left of

Block Party

(5.8).

Climb face just left of a short left-facing corner system past horizontals to more horizontals and finish with an interesting right-slanting rail system.
content.protection:
4 bolts. No fixed anchors but you might get some gear in about 20' back or use the anchors on

Brickmaster

about 15' to the right and 8' back from the lip.

content.description:
Why not? One can link up several climbs in a girdle traverse by starting at Swabbies Deck, clip two of its bolts then take a thin traversing line rightwards, above the obvious ledge* with crux coming between bolts 4 and 5 to reach a handrail, finish by heading up good steep holds just right of Log Cabin and using the anchor for Block on Block.

*You could use the ledge but it would be easy class 5 and not as interesting.
content.protection: Six bolts and a bolted chain anchor - some drag possible. Walk off. A fall on the traverse may hit you on the ledge below.

content.description:
From right to left: Descend from the ledge on good rails and traverse to the start of Swabbies Deck - then go up a bit to the finishing ledge. One can now reverse the descent and go back to the starting ledge.

Could be made harder if needed.
content.location: A ledge above the ground,Â  to the right of Block on Block.

content.description:
Located on the face between

Brickmaster

(5.8+) on the left and

Block on Block

(5.6) on the right.

Mostly easy moves past horizontals and edges to a crux at the 3rd bolt moving over a small roof/overlap (going right at the crux makes this 5.6). Shares anchors with

Brickmaster

to the left.
Reachy moves at the top. Small feet and limited hands make this one a fun albeit a short puzzle.
content.location:
Smack damb in the middle just right of

Block Party

.

content.description: Fun climb lay back to through the roof then find the holds. Small feet and positive hands.
content.protection: 3 bolts. If you are setting up a TR then use the crack to setup a separate anchor as the pendulum from using the chains can make for a wild ride. I used a #9 Nut and a .75 C4.
content.location: Facing the block (looking North) the route is the second from the left that goes over the obvious but very small roof.

content.description: Solid jugs all the way to the top. If you are toproping clip the 3rd bolt for a directional to prevent a pendulum into the dead stump at the base.
content.location: when facing the block (north) it is the right most route.
